result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Lee Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court
Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  If able to get into in-patient program the employment/eduction condition could be stayed per agent.  DE has 85 days credit if probation revoked.  6 days credit.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: revoking huber privileges

Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to reinstate huber privileges.  State requests 60 days revocation retroactive to February 20, which would be time served.  Court orders reinstatement of Huber privileges as of May 4, 2017.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties rec/rev PSI.  Atty Frank makes small correction to PSI on page 6.  Atty Frank notes they have a witness that would like to make a statement.  DE's mother makes a statement.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Frank makes his recommendations.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

16CF12
Ct 1:
6 days credit and 85 days credit ONLY if revoked

16CF37
Ct 1:  
15 days credit and 85 days credit ONLY if revoked

Probation for 3 years on each concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
7 months jail w/huber on each concurrent to each other to commence FORTHWITH
$518.00 x 2 to be paid w/in 60 days to Clerk's Office or set up payment plan
85 days sentence credit to be applied on both ONLY if probation is revoked
AODA/treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription and then only if used as prescribed
Random UA's
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education
If able to get into in-patient program the employment/education condition could be stayed per agent
DNA samples to be provided
Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests PSI and to revoke bond. Atty. Frank makes statement to leave bail alone. State gives basis for revoking bail.  Atty. Frank states if released CM would stay at 227 W. Main St., Merrimac.  Guilty plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court revokes bond.  Court orders PSI.  Report to be done by Dec. 14, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank requests 16CF12 and 16CF37 be set for plea hearing w/PSI to be requested.  Notes DE is currently getting counseling/treatment and notes Dane Co matters.  Court notes 16CF240 is on for today too but has not yet been set for prelim.  Atty Frank requests time limits be waived for prelim in that one.  There is no agreement as to that case.  Court suggests another PTC be set.  State agrees w/recommendations by Atty Frank but recommends it be off the 1pm calendar in Br 3.  Court directs Atty Frank to get a date w/Br 3 for the plea but will leave JT on until then.  In 16CF240, the State requests this matter track w/the other 2 and Atty Frank can talk about that one w/the DA prior to plea in 16CF12 and 16CF37.  Bonds continued in all matters.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds good cause to extend preliminary hearing and time limits.   Court reviews financial information.  Court finds condiitionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Peter Masana @$65/hr @ $20.00/weekly commencing 2/19/16.
280-1210  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez by video from LEC with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Raabe responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $1,500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription and only then if used accordingly.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:45 am.
